video_title: How to Pass Tier 1 & 2 Selections Part 1/3: Difference Between Tier 1 & 2
key_facts: The primary difference between Tier 1 and Tier 2 selection processes is that Tier 2 focuses on team events with negative reinforcement (yelling), while Tier 1 uses individual events with neutral reinforcement (no feedback).
The three main operational Tier 1 units are identified as Delta Force, DEVGRU (SEAL Team Six), and the Intelligence Support Activity (ISA).
The speaker is a former Tier 1 operator who also served as an instructor for a Tier 1 selection, providing an insider's perspective on how these processes work.
Tier 1 units utilize color-based codenames for identification: Delta Force is Green, SEAL Team Six is Blue, and the ISA is Orange.
Tier 2 units, referred to as 'white SOF', include Rangers, Special Forces, MARSOC Raiders, Marine Force Recon, and most Navy SEAL teams.
